Property.Name: DATA_BIT_WIDTH_p
Property.Description: Determines the width of the buses for each of the I and Q data generation memory elements - if less than 16, the most significant DATA_BIT_WIDTH_p bits of I and Q on the out port will be filled. Value is expect to be less than or equal to 16.

Property.Name: LFSR_POLYNOMIAL_p
Property.Description: E.g., a value of 1,1,0,1 would correspond to an LFSR polynomial of x^4 + x^3 + (0*x^2) + x^1 + 1 (+1 is always implied regardless of value).

Property.Name: LFSR_SEED_p
Property.Description: Out-of-reset value of the Linear Feedback Shift Register (only affects output data in LFSR mode). This value should never be all zeros, which would cause the register to always have a value of all zeros regardless of polynomial value.

Property.Name: ZLM_WHEN_NUM_SAMPLES_REACHED_p
Property.Description: When value is true and num_samples property value is not -1, worker will generate Zero-Length-Message after num_samples amount of samples have been sent out the output port.

Property.Name: messageSize_bytes
Property.Description: Message size in bytes. When the value of (num_samples * num bytes per sample) is less than this property's value, the value of (num_samples * num bytes per sample) is used as the message size.

Property.Name: num_samples
Property.Description: Maximum number of samples which will be sent out of the output port once out of reset. Note that samples are only sent when the enable property has a value of true. When the value of this property is -1, samples will be sent indefinitely (obeying backpressure from the connected worker, of course).

Property.Name: fixed_value
Property.Description: The value of this property will be used for I (and the bit-reversed version of this value will be used for Q) to send to the output port when the mode property's value is 'fixed'.

Property.Name: mode
Property.Description: Counter, walking ones, Linear Feedback Shift Register, or fixed value.

Property.Name: enable
Property.Description: When the worker is not in reset, this property must have a value of true for the data to be sent to the output.

Property.Name: LFSR_bit_reverse
Property.Description: Used to determine the LFSR shift direction. When true, the DATA_BIT_WIDTH_p-bits wide LFSR will be reversed for both I and Q.
